data.title: International Beauty Industry Awards
data.text:
THE INDEPENDENT JUDGING COUNCIL

At The IBI Awards, the judges are as diverse as the entrants.

The Independent Judging Council are the very definition of Beauty Artisans and leaders in their fields. They are continually inspiring and encouraging the beauty community by freely sharing their incredible knowledge, talents and passion with the Beauty Community.

Each Independent Judging Council Member, past or present, has a unique set of talents, specialties, passion, experience, ethos, and beliefs that ensures each and every one of our Judges are suited to expertly select the Winners and Finalists in a fair and unbiased manner.

Interested in joining the Judging Council? Apply here

Angelique Velez can quite literally say, "Love raised me, lipstick saved me." As a makeup artist and founder of Breakups to Makeup, Velez utilized her personal journey with heartbreak to inspire the creation of Breakups to Makeup (B2M), now one of the country's most sought-after high-quality accessory and apparel brands for makeup enthusiasts. Sold online and in retail stores including Sephora, QVC, Walmart, Urban Outfitters, Ricky's, and NYLON Shop.

Born and raised in New York from Puerto Rican and Cuban descent, Velez launched B2M in June 2013 to spread the message that makeup is more than just a product—it's an art form. With over a decade of experience as a makeup artist, Angelique recognized the significance of this creative outlet and sought to educate and inspire others while transforming heartbreak into moments of self-celebration.

Under her leadership, coupled with unmatched creativity and a massive passion for infusing wit and glam into Breakups to Makeup, her iconic clutches including "Love Raised Me Lipstick Saved Me" to "I Would Cry But My Mascara is Designer," have graced the hands of legends such as Cher and have been featured in national media outlets such as Refinery29, Marie Claire, Allure, and Latina, among others.

Prior to embracing entrepreneurship and dedicating herself full-time to her passion project, Velez was, and still is, a professional makeup artist. Velez has had the opportunity to be a part of fashion shows for Michael Kors, Marc by Marc Jacobs, Project Runway, Alexander Wang, and Tommy Hilfiger. She has also worked notable televised events multiple times including the MTV Video Music Awards and the Victoria's Secret Fashion Show. She is also a proud member of the IATSE Local 798 Union.

Velez currently resides in New York, but enjoys traveling, while also being a full-time mom. She has a podcast, called Hey Glowfriend, that encompasses her entire journey, which is available on all podcast platforms.

With a passion for hair since her young ages, Christine captures her creativity through the canvas of hair. Christine is an Australian born and raised artist, based in Sydney, hoping to empower and grow with other industry creatives.

During her training, Christine gained intensive salon experience working at Ultrafade by Rich in Sydney Australia.

Christine also holds 3 years of on-set experience assisting and learning from the top hairstylists in Australia.

She has worked on various fashion shows for AAFW throughout the years, and is most proud of her contribution to the Carla Zampatti Powerhouse exhibition 2022 and the ACMI Goddess exhibition celebrating women in film 2023.

Her work is seen in RUSSH, Issue Mag, cover of Sunday Life magazine, cover of Solstice magazine, Shuba Mag and Mob Journal.

Today, Christine is the director of UFSTYLES, a special events and bridal team, a sister company to Ultrafade by Rich. Christine applies her knowledge from the fashion industry working with different hair types to build UFSTYLES into being a diverse hairstyling brand. Christine and her team of passionate artists are focused on bringing their A-game to ensure they deliver great hair styles and energy to the wedding day!

Kristin Ker Anderson is a makeup artist whose journey began unexpectedly during the COVID-19 pandemic lockdown. Kristin's life took a transformative turn when she reluctantly joined TikTok at the urging of friends. Despite initial reservations, she found herself drawn to the creativity of makeup transformations showcased on the platform.

With no prior experience and minimal makeup supplies, Kristin immersed herself in the world of makeup artistry. Through trial and error, she honed her skills and discovered a newfound passion for creating stunning makeup looks. Her talent quickly caught the attention of viewers worldwide, earning her millions of followers on TikTok.

Kristin's philosophy revolves around genuine passion and self-belief. She finds fulfillment in the creative process and the joy of seeing her visions come to life. Despite setbacks, including the loss of her main TikTok account, Kristin remains resilient and unwavering in her commitment to her craft.

Beyond makeup, Kristin values the sense of community and support she has found online. Strangers have become like family, united by a shared appreciation for creativity and positivity. Her story serves as an inspiration to others to embrace their passions and pursue their dreams with determination and resilience.

Kristin Ker Anderson continues to make her mark in the world of makeup artistry, one masterpiece at a time, with an unstoppable spirit and a commitment to spreading love and positivity.

As a celebrated Beauty Expert and Celebrity Hairstylist with over 15 years of experience, Janet Jackson has left her mark on the sets of numerous national TV shows, both behind the scenes and on-air. She has had the honor of styling a diverse roster of celebrities, including Winnie Harlow, Aimee Lou Wood, Sheryl Lee Ralph, Gemma Arterton, Rita Ora, Iman, Usher, Aja Naomi King, Keshia Chante, Bobby Canavalle, and many more. Janet's journey as the Founder & CEO of JouJou Hair Studio and recognition as a Contessa "Elite Master Hairstylist" Finalist have afforded her a unique perspective and skill set within the beauty industry.

Through her salon, Janet Jackson is not only setting industry standards but also actively training and mentoring the next generation of hair stylists, fostering their growth and ensuring excellence in the field. With her ability to work with all hair types, commitment to "Hair Care First," and extensive on-air experience, Janet is confident in her ability to be a valuable asset and leader on any team.

Janet's contributions and featured work in top-tier magazines such as Oprah Magazine, Elle, FASHION, and Flare, as well as advertisements for renowned brands like L’Oréal Paris, Louis Vuitton, Holt Renfrew, and Nike, showcase the depth of her experience and expertise. Awards such as Contessa - 2024 Session Hairstylist of the Year and Cafa Awards' 2023 Hair Artist of the Year underscore Janet's dedication to excellence. Janet's influence extends globally, advocating for inclusivity and excellence in the beauty industry.

And for the first time ever, Janet Jackson, with her unparalleled experience will be taking part in the International Beauty Awards as a judge. With an eagle eye for detail and a passion for creativity, Janet brings her A-game to the judging panel.

Lan Nguyen-Grealis is a celebrity, beauty, fashion and multi award winning makeup artist and author of Art & Makeup and ProMakeup Design Books. Lan has appeared as a guest judge on the successful BBC Series, “Glow Up”.

Lan regularly collaborates on many shows at London Fashion Week as the key designer, leading a team of exceptional makeup assistants which she dedicates her time to mentor. Through her love of education for nearly two decades, Lan shares her tips and tricks in the media and travels worldwide as a speaker. Her mission is to empower women by tailoring looks that women want for themselves. Not just based on trends but the unique beauty that everyone has.

Creating show stopping looks, Lan is sought after for her creative flair for natural beauty and cutting edge creative design. Her collaboration with the beauty brand Makeup Revolution resulted in a custom designed makeup palette that surpassed expectations, going viral after its launch and eventually winning a People’s Award and Global Best Innovation award 2022. She has also worked on publications such as Glamour, Elle, Marie Claire, Vogue, GQ, Numero and many more including talents such as Paloma Faith, Raye, Lisa Snowdon, Nicole Scherzinger, Kimberley Wyatt, Ashley Roberts, Melanie C, Emma Bunton, Millie Bobby Brown and many more.

USA and UK color expert Jack Howard’s career has spanned three decades and four continents. His blend of highly technical color work and inspirational education sees him in constant demand across the globe regularly traveling to the UAE, North America and throughout Europe.

Widely credited with bringing Balayage to the UK and still a world leading innovator in the technique, Jack developed his own brand education to share his knowledge. Today he delivers his hugely popular courses to high profile salons including Toni & Guy and Trevor Sorbie as well as teaching thousands of colourists and color salons worldwide. Currently a color ambassador for L'oreal Professional USA and L’oreal Professional UK. In his career Jack has had many influential roles including UK Colour Spokesperson & International Artist for L’Oréal Professional and UK & European guest artist for Fudge. Today, as well as collaborating with Gold Fever hair extensions, Jack was the Schwarzkopf Professional’s Global BLONDME Ambassador. In addition, he was also named Denman Global Colour Ambassador, a role in which he will use his technical know-how and experience to help develop new and innovative color tools.

Based in London, and Washington DC clients such as Gillian Anderson, Poppy Delevingne, Suki Waterhouse and Abbey Clancy to name but a few. Jack’s technical skill, understanding of fashion and innovative use of color has seen him receive countless accolades and awards. Most recently he was given the Colour World UK’s ‘Commercial Colour Genius’ award in 2019 and 20 and voted Marie Claire Hair Colourist of the Year in 2018. British hairdressing awards - social stylist 2019 2020.

Kiyah Wright is one of the most sought-after hairstylists in the entertainment industry. Kiyah, a multi Emmy Award winning celebrity hairstylist and Beauty Authority, has created the industry’s most sought-after hairstyles for celebrities such as Tyra Banks, Jennifer Hudson, Halle Berry, Ciara, Gabrielle Union, Taraji P. Henson, Laverne Cox to name a few.

When Kiyah is not creating the hottest red carpet looks or styling the industries top celebrities, her work can be found gracing the pages of magazine covers such as Vanity Fair, GQ, Elle, InStyle, Essence and Vogue. In her tenure, she has been the Celebrity Ambassador for the biggest brands including Proctor & Gamble’s, Head & Shoulders, Clairol Professional, and Pantene.

She is the go-to makeover guru for Access Hollywood Live and inked a deal with Penguin Random House to distribute her debut book, "From Beauty to Business: The Guaranteed Strategy to Building, Running, and Growing a Successful Beauty Business". In her debut book, Kiyah lays out the crucial success strategies and lessons not taught in beauty schools such as managing your finances, branding, marketing, product distribution, the power of social media, and more. Filled with inspirational and relatable stories from someone who has been there, this practical, one-of-a-kind sourcebook is a vital educational resource for beauty professionals at all stages of their career.

After working with the best companies in town, Kiyah took a leap of faith and created her own line, MUZE|HAIR. Kiyah’s MUZE|HAIR line is trusted by Hollywood’s hottest celebrities and offers a collection of premium wigs, extensions and products that provide Instant Beauty Solutions to women across the globe.

Known widely as one of the most influential Makeup Artists in the world, Rae Morris is not only a best-selling Author of multiple titles but also four-times Australian Makeup Artist of the Year, and has been inducted into multiple industry ‘Halls of Fame’. Collaborating with some of the world’s leading photographers, Rae’s makeup has graced magazine covers as well as fashion and beauty editorials including Vogue, Harper’s Bazaar, Marie Claire, Rolling Stone, Oyster, Tush, Citizen K and InStyle.

As L’Oréal Paris’ longest serving Makeup Director (2003-2013), she has directed over 150 fashion shows.

In 2008 her first book Makeup: The Ultimate Guide had an overwhelming worldwide success – since then she has published 4 additional books, including Express Makeup in 2011 and Timeless Makeup in 2013. The instructional books are currently used as training manuals in top makeup schools, medical clinics and beauty retailers globally. Rae is a huge inspiration among young aspiring Makeup Artists world-wide. Rae's 6th book, Rae Morris Makeup Masterclass was released in 2016 and has been hailed as her definitive work introducing for the first time her ‘Eye Phi’ technique and scientific approach to beauty.

Rae is also the designer behind the Rae Morris Magnetic Brush Range – the first magnetic makeup brush range in the world. Handmade in Japan by one of the world’s last living Masters of Craft, the range has been acclaimed as not only the most innovative, but one of the best makeup brush ranges in the world.

Rae is a regular keynote speaker at global beauty events, but is also sought after for international dermatology and cosmetic surgery conferences, where she collaborates with the world’s top doctors in outlining her scientific approach to the beauty aesthetic.

Rae, when not developing products for her range, still gets a kick out of seeing her work published and thrives on the chaos of directing shows.

Jordan Liberty is an LA-based Creative Director, Makeup Artist, Photographer, and Educator represented by Rebel Brand Management. In addition to producing campaigns for leading beauty brands, his work in consulting and product development have made him the secret weapon behind the success of many well-known brands and products.

Recent clients and collaborators include Fashionnova, Nars Cosmetics, Disney, Wet n’ Wild, Pat Mcgrath Labs, LA Girl, LA Colors, Ciate London, Urban Decay, Mac Cosmetics, Bite Beauty, Benefit Cosmetics, Melt Cosmetics, Sigma Beauty, Sephora, Anastasia Beverly Hills, Dose Of Color, Eighth Day Skin, Covergirl, Realtechniques, Tatcha, Clinique, Lorac, and Nyx Cosmetics.

Liberty and his work have been featured on the Today Show, seen online on Popsugar, WWD, Vogue, Insider, Oprah Magazine, Who What Wear, Refinery29, Yahoo!, and W Magazine, and printed on the pages of Glamour, On Makeup, Ladygunn, and Elle. In recognition of his work, he received a coveted "Best of Beauty" award from Allure and was named "Artist of the Year" by The Makeup Show.

Respected in the industry for his professional approach to education (via his former youTube channel), he continues teaching pro-level workshops, makeup classes and seminars when not in the studio — having completed 57 events and masterclasses in 23 countries to date. temporarily on hiatus due to the global pandemic, liberty restarted his international beauty tour in 2022 along with his pro shadow program (currently exclusive to Los Angeles) and will resume normal operation in 2023.

As a 2-time cancer survivor, he is proud to support the American Association for Cancer Research (AACR) as an ambassador. The AACR funds global research efforts towards the prevention, treatment, and cure for all 200+ forms of cancer in adults and children.

Amanda Christan has worked as a makeup artist in the beauty and fashion industry, mainly in New York, for over 25 years. She is a well-known beauty expert, and her work has appeared in leading fashion magazines, like Harper’s Bazaar, New York Magazine and Rolling Stone. Her makeup has also been seen on the runways of New York fashion week. Her celebrity clients have included Sarah Jessica Parker, Natalie Portman, Sharon Stone and Isabella Rossellini, to name a few.

Amanda started doing makeup with her Grandmother, Zula when she was a little girl growing up in Georgia. At that time, Amanda would only dream of going to New York City and becoming a makeup artist. Yet at 24, she did leave the south and headed to the big city. It took Amanda about 10 years of hard work to make it, but she believes that it was worth it. As a result of moving to New York City, and beginning her career as a makeup artist, Amanda’s work has been featured in leading fashion magazines, like Harper's Bazaar, New York Magazine, and even on the cover of Rolling Stone with Fiona Apple. Seeing her makeup on the runways of New York Fashion Week was also a blast. Some of Amanda’s celebrity clients include, Sarah Jessica Parker, Natalie Portman, Sharon Stone, and Isabella Rossellini, to name a few. Amanda considers working at the Grammy Awards, with musicians Sheryl Crow, Fiona Apple, and Joan Baez the highlight of her career. Amanda was also the spokesperson for Max Factor and Bourjois, making national television appearances and press events with top beauty editors. Through her art and love of makeup, Amanda has always worked to create a space where all women can feel beautiful in their own skin, as she believes that beauty makes women feel alive and helps them discover their innate power and grace.

JSterling is a New York based makeup artist and educator / lecturer on the subject of beauty and inspiration. His work has appeared in countless regional, national and international magazines. He has worked with a diverse range of celebrities including Liam Neeson, Mandy Moore, Natasha Henstridge, Robin Tuney, Vivian Green and Kherington Payne, to name a few.

JSterling has worked in all aspects of the beauty industry. As a licensed professional, he has worked as a hair stylist, esthetician, makeup artist and is a New York State certified instructor.

As an educator, he has been adamant about giving back to an industry that has been so very kind to him. Over the course of his career many talented experts have generously given of their time and insights. Increasingly the beauty industry and its connected fields have been pushed into the spotlight earning much deserved respect.

He believes when the spotlight turns to us, we must be professional and meet the challenge. He strongly believes in the transformative power of makeup. However, the transformation does not stop at the physical transformation. Beyond the promise that cosmetics offer exists their true impact. That is, empowering the individual, enhancing self-esteem and promoting a sense of well-being, to truly go beyond the bounds of beauty.

Anastasia is a makeup artist and hairstylist with a passion for creating in many genres including: advertising, brand campaigns, model tests, and fashion shows. When crafting her artistry, Anastasia always tries to combine high-end editorial and iconic glam in her looks, which helps her to create a unique and recognisable style.

As an “alien” with an ‘Extraordinary Ability Visa’ in the US, she knows exactly what it costs to work hard for a dream to come true. From an accountant to a successful artist, Anastasia has made a huge leap and has come a long way to build a strong career and an incredible reputation in the international beauty industry. Her extensive clientele list includes such brands as: Louis Vuitton, Nina Ricci, Giorgio Armani Beauty, L'Oreal, Wella, R+Co to name a few. She has created makeup and hair designs for editorials that have been published in Elle, L'Officiel, Grazia, Glamour etc. Anastasia has also taken part in shows keyed by huge artists such as Evanie Frausto (Luar, Sandy Liang), Frankie Boyd (Midnight Studios), Aaron de Mey (Peter Do), Kiki Gifford (Hermès). She knows the backstage life of a makeup artist and hairstylist inside out, and is always ready to help new aspiring artists to find their way in this magical industry!

A beauty photographer and self-portraiture artist specializing in stylized conceptual vivid imagery, Daryna Barykina currently, resides in Jacksonville, FL, but constantly travels for assignments, photography classes, and speaking opportunities.

Daryna uses her talents to create clean, beautiful, polished photography, as well as over-the-top, bold, and moody imagery.

Becoming a photographer has always been Daryna’s dream. As a little girl, she used to tear out ads from fashion magazines in the waiting room of the beauty salon her mother frequented. Over the years, Daryna made quite the collection of images in which she found inspiration, but did not dare to believe that one day her dreams would become reality.

In 2011, Daryna’s family relocated from Ukraine to Florida, where she began pursuing a career in the beauty industry. It was not easy for Daryna, but her background in photography, her education and knowledge in business helped her achieve her goals. Before moving to America, Daryna had graduated from the Kyiv School of Photography in 2010, and concurrently completed a Master’s Degree in Business Administration at Ukrainian – American Concordia University.

Creating advertising campaigns for beauty brands is Daryna’s passion, but she finds the editorial world just as captivating. Daryna’s work has been published in professional magazines throughout the world, such as Estetica (Italia), American Salon (USA), Salon Today (USA), Modern Salon (USA), Behind the Chair.com on paper (USA), Salon Opinion (Australia), Creative Head (UK), Hair’s How (Russia), Salon News Asia (Taiwan); also, Daryna’s work has been recognized across the web and is featured on websites, such as Glamour.com, Seventeen.com, Elle.pl, Elle.ru, etc.

Even though Daryna loves her job, she always tries to make time for personal work, as it fuels her inspiration and is always rewarding. In fact, one of Daryna’s projects with the social message, “Bruised Behind the Mask,” got a lot of attention from the beauty industry brands participating in the program, “CUT IT OUT ®: Salons Against Domestic Abuse,” ran by the Professional Beauty Association.

Love for the industry inspired Daryna to explore other media, which culminated in her becoming NAHA Makeup Artist of the Year Finalist in 2018 as well as 2020. In June 2019, Daryna had the honor of being makeup director for the Licensed to Create Awards Show, Cosmoprof Artistic Team presentation.

Daryna’s competitive nature led to her being one of the go-to hair competition photographers. In that capacity, Daryna has captured countless winning entries for such competitions as NAHA, Color Zoom, Style & Color Trophy, Show Us Your Artistry, etc. In addition, in 2020, Daryna captured the Grand Prize, Lady Gaga X Adobe Chromatica Tour competition; in 2018, she received the North Florida Rising Star Award in Photography, and in 2015, the Advertising Photographer of the Year title by Neutral Density Magazine.

For over 20 years, Nick Stenson has embraced the beauty industry with a career that encompasses salon owner, celebrity stylist, educator, ambassador, trend setter, editor, executive, board member and entrepreneur. His work spans over multiple channels, both nationally and internationally, offering professional hairstylists and consumers a glimpse into the ever-changing world of beauty. As a renowned expert in both hair, makeup and skin care, Nick’s editorial work has appeared on the covers of Modern Salon, American Salon, Beauty Launchpad, SalonEVO and Matrix Magazine plus, issues of Woman’s Day, Vogue, Bride, Redbook, InStyle, Teen Vogue, US Weekly, OK, and People magazines. He has been featured in stories on NBC and CBS News, and can be found regularly on media outlets including Good Morning America, The Today Show and The Wendy Williams Show.

As a celebrity stylist, Nick has created looks for Kevin Jonas, Nicky Hilton, Fergie, Vanessa Hudgens, Giuliana Rancic, Simone Biles, Eden Sassoon, Andi Dorfman, Jaime King, Rumer Willis, Ariel Winter, Ashley Tisdale, Grady Powell, Italia Ricci, Odette Annable, Keltie Knight, Erin Richards, Kate Mara, Kat Graham, Tiffany Hendra, Alexa Chung and Diana Madison.

As a stylist, humanitarian and one seeking to embrace beauty, Nick hopes to leave his mark as a respected professional voice and face of the industry, known for challenging the world to recognize beauty in all. He believes in inner beauty first and foremost, which led to the launch of his #iseeyourbeauty campaign emphasizing inner beauty through beauty direction, positivity and community. As a philanthropist, Nick has been a champion for L’Oreal’s Hairdressers Against AIDS, an organization that raises awareness and funds to find a cure for HIV and AIDS. When challenging himself as a stylist, Nick accomplished multiple nominations/wins at the North American Hair Styling awards (NAHA), which were widely acclaimed and published. He currently serves on the board of the International SalonSpa Business Network (ISBN) and Cosmetologists Chicago, host of America's Beauty Show, to share his experience and insight to better serve the professional salon industry.

As Senior Vice President of Store and Services Operations for Ulta Beauty, Nick sets the course for all corporate store operations, services and education at over 1,200 locations. Together with his first-of-its-kind Ulta Beauty Pro Team of elite-brand celebrity hairstylists/educators, he translates trends into the cuts, colors and styles that form the backbone of Ulta Beauty’s seasonal salon offerings. He also leads the corporate services team to develop and drive the strategic vision and execution of the services business including services innovation, education, marketing and events, as well as continuing to find synergy between Ulta Beauty’s services and retail business.

As Brand Ambassador and celebrity stylist for L’ORÉAL’s Matrix, Nick graces the stage as an educator, platform artist and spokesperson for industry venues and trade shows. He is instrumental in creating some of the industry’s most popular trends using prestigious hair color portfolios for Matrix Professional Haircare and Color. His trends and techniques are shared with stylists from all over the world to help them fortify their own talents and strengths.

Nick recently launched his own company CURIOUS Brushes by Nick Stenson. It is a line of styling brushes that are quickly becoming an industry game-changer in blow-outs. These unique styling brushes were crafted by utilizing his talent to create the perfect style for all hair diversities.
